snippet: The agency said that a man who raised over $120,000 to create a board game spent the money instead on personal expenses.
abstract: Federal Trade Commission announces $120,000 settlement in its first case involving Internet crowdfunding; charged Erik Chevalier with defrauding some 1,246 people who gave pledges of $75 or more over Kickstarter to help him create board game that never materialized.
lead_paragraph: The agency said that a man who raised over $120,000 to create a board game spent the money instead on personal expenses.

headline.main: F.T.C. Reaches Settlement in a Kickstarter Scheme
headline.print_headline: F.T.C. Reaches Settlement in Kickstarter Fraud Case
